pullRequest.title: Issue #8118: Enforce -e for all maven commands
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #8118: Enforce -e for all maven commands
I add RegexpSingleline to finish this task and I change
(mvn [^-])|(mvn \-[^e])
to
(mvn [^-])|(mvn \-[^e\-v])
to avoid false positive on
mvn --version
mvn -version

nodes.bodyText:
please add <property name="message" value="mvn execution should be with '-e' option to produce error message in case of problem"/> in this case you do not need comment above, the comments the better.
https://books.sonatype.com/mvnref-book/reference/running-sect-options.html

+    <module name="RegexpSingleline">
+        <property name="format" value="(mvn [^-])|(mvn \-[^e\-v])"/>
+        <property name="fileExtensions" value="sh, yml"/>

nodes.bodyText:
I have a concern about adding - and v and that it could lead to false negatives. We are only looking for the 1 character and not even testing what comes after --.
I don't know all maven arguments, but here is some examples I went off of:
mvn test
mvn -e test
mvn -version
mvn --version
mvn --not-e
mvn -verbose no e

Can we do some type of lookahead check for this? Maybe: (mvn [^-])|(mvn \-(?!v)(?!-v)[^e])
This won't hamper performance either, will it?
